story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Korea, there was a kind and curious little girl named Soo-min. She loved to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw.

One day, Soo-min was walking through the forest near her home, looking for interesting plants and animals to study. As she was walking, she heard a faint rustling sound coming from a nearby bush. She carefully approached the bush and peeked inside.

To her surprise, she saw a small, winged creature with bright green skin and big, curious eyes. It was a baby dragon!

Soo-min was overjoyed to have found such a rare and magical creature. She carefully picked up the baby dragon and cradled it in her arms.

"Don't be afraid, little one," Soo-min said softly. "I will take care of you and keep you safe."

And so, Soo-min brought the baby dragon home and cared for it as if it were her own. She fed it and played with it and taught it all about the world.

The baby dragon grew quickly, and soon it was as big as a house. But Soo-min was not afraid. She knew that the dragon was gentle and kind, just like her.

Together, Soo-min and the dragon explored the world and had many exciting adventures. They visited the tops of mountains, the depths of the ocean, and even the clouds in the sky.

But no matter where they went or what they did, Soo-min always made sure to take care of the dragon and keep it safe. And the dragon, in turn, protected Soo-min from any harm.

Years went by, and Soo-min and the dragon became inseparable. They were the best of friends, and they loved each other dearly.

But eventually, it was time for the dragon to return to its own kind. Soo-min was sad to see it go, but she knew it was the right thing to do.

Before the dragon left, it gave Soo-min a special gift - a tiny, winged creature just like itself. Soo-min was overjoyed and promised to take care of the new baby dragon just as she had its parent.

And so, Soo-min's adventures continued, with a new generation of dragons by her side. She lived a long, happy life, always exploring and learning and discovering new things.

And every night, before she went to bed, Soo-min would look up at the stars and think of her dear friend, the dragon, who had brought so much joy and magic into her life.

The end.

Now it's time to close your eyes and dream of your own adventures. Good night, my dear daughter. I love you.
